newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Feb housing starts strongest in nearly 3 years.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Feb housing starts strongest in nearly 3 years.

text.p: Builders broke ground on new homes and apartments at the fastest clip in nearly three years during February, the Commerce Department said on Tuesday, bouncing back from severe weather in January.

Total starts shot up 12.2 percent to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 1.53 million in February -- the strongest building pace since 1.56 million in March 1994 -- after a revised 0.7 percent gain in January.
